This 2021 Porsche 718 Spyder is finished in Chalk over black leather and Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Having 4,800 miles, the car was optioned with a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring as well as Satin Black-finished 20″ 718 Spyder alloy wheels, a manually retractable black soft top, bi-xenon headlights with PDLS, rear parking sensors, a backup camera, carbon-fiber interior trim, the Light Design Package, a Bose sound system, automatic climate control, heated power-adjustable seats, and Porsche Communication Management. This 718 Spyder was acquired by the seller in 2024 and is now offered in Ohio with a build sheet, the owner’s manual, a battery tender, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Chalk, and exterior equipment includes a manually retractable black soft top, rear parking sensors, a backup camera, and bi-xenon headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System (PDLS) as well as power-folding side mirrors, gloss black accents, side air intakes, and dual exhaust outlets. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

Satin Black-finished 20″ 718 Spyder alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Stopping power is provided by ventilated and dimpled rotors with red-finished calipers at each corner. The car is equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM).

The heated power-adjustable seats are trimmed in black leather and Race-Tex and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, carpets, and door panels. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, and additional appointments include the Light Design Package, a Bose sound system, Apple CarPlay, automatic climate control, cruise control, Porsche-branded floor mats, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation.

The heated multifunction steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, and a TFT LCD screen. A stopwatch is mounted atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 4,800 miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

Located in a sealed compartment forward of the rear trunk, the 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 414 horsepower and 317 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in January 2025, at which time the windshield washer fluid reservoir cap was replaced.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring. Additional photos of the underside are provided in the gallery.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
